p.s: As a young person, I can say that love is an important topic at our age.
Finding someone you really love, and who of course loves you the same.
Learning to express your own feelings, especially romantic feelings is hard, explaining them to the person you like is even harder.
I still have to learn how to express my feelings, because sometimes I don't know how I feel.
Growing up, developing feelings, expressing feelings and dealing with feelings are part of our development.
Even Grown upsgrown-ups struggle with it sometimes.
I haven't read sonnets in our englishEnglish class, but I read some on my own and I can say that I like Shakespeare's Sonnetsonnets.
At first I didn't understand it, but as soon as I understood, I thought it really describes the feeling of love.
I feel the same, as the speaker.
My life was pretty rough sometimes, but when I met my Boyfriendboyfriend, it made the black night beauteous (v. 12).
He is my anchor and helped me getting braver and made me feel better about myself.
We live together, which comes with many compromises and conflicts.
But we still love each other and think about out other half the whole time.
As ShakespearShakespeare said day by day and night by night.

ShakespearShakespeare expresses my feelings really good, love isn't about saying I love you, it's about a connection between two sould combining their lifeslives, but still living or going their own way/life.
My boyfriend and I are really emotional and we both like reading and writing.
Sometimes we write each other some poems (small ones).
He once wrote me a really impressive one.
ShakespearShakespeare reminded me on this poem and I instantly knew how ShakespearShakespeare felt and how the person he likes has to feel.
My boyfriend wrote: you are like a little flower, growing and blooming in a dark and cruel place.
Even though your environment is trying to poison you, you still mangedmanaged to be one of the lovelyestloveliest Personspersons I ever met.
You are like a small, shivering flame in the darkest darkness, still you're able to brighten up everything.
It reminded me of ShakespearsShakespeare's verse like a jewel in ghastly night (v. 11).
As a summary I can say that I liked this sonnet really much.
More than other sonnets I read.
At first it was hard to understand, because I had to look up a couple of words.
But as soon as I understood it, I liked it.
It's appealing and very catchy.
I would love to read more sonnets like this one.
ShakespearShakespeare managed to express a lot of feelings, different feelings, with only 14 verses.
Love is one of the most misunderstoodstmisunderstood feelings in the world, and for a young person which is trying to find its place in the world, it's a topic that is important to us (young people).
